resources.string: Discover the best and brightest chefs, around the world.
This is a sample cater item.
Select the dates of your event here.
Enter the location of your event here.
Are You a Chef? Sign Up Here
Please head to \'Settings\' -> \'Banking\' to make changes to your account.
Please share with our community why hope to serve them.

* Please note that Taïste, Inc does not save any personal banking information, but instead collects only what is necessary for our third party banking provider \'Stripe\' to be in compliance with federal banking regulation. *
Currently, Stripe is our banking provider. We require each of our chef\'s to view Stripe\'s Terms of Service before accepting payouts and orders.
* An MCC Code is a 4 digit Merchant Category Code describing your business. We recommend 5812 for catering services. *
* Feel free to use any personal or social media website describing your business. *
* If your company has an Employer Identification Number, please enter here. If not, please enter the social security number used to do business. *
* Each account is required to have a representative to take responsibility for the account. *
* All owners with 25% or more ownership must be reported.
Do you hope to find local, regional, or national chefs?
Please sign in to create new profile
* All passwords must be at least 8 characters long, with 1 letter, 1 number, and 1 special character. *
Need an Account? Sign Up Here
Please check your email to verify your email address.

Please note that federal regulations require that all cooking for catering and meal kit services be done in a licensed commercial kitchen. By continuing you acknowledge this regulation and promise to abide by it.
Are you having trouble with a specific event?
Please provide a brief description of the issue.
Please describe the issue in depth.
Please place the item title in the space below.
* Credits accrue when an order is cancelled, or when coupons are applicable. Credits also accrue if a chef does not accept an order. All orders are refundable. *

These Terms of Service (\'Agreement\') govern your access to and use of the culinary software-as-a-service (\'Taïste\') mobile application provided by Taïste, Inc (\'Provider\'). By accessing or using Taïste, you agree to be bound by this Agreement.
b. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account login credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.
a. To use Taïste, you must create a user account by providing accurate and complete information.
c. You agree to notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account or any other security breach.
c. You are solely responsible for any content you submit, including menu listings, reviews, and feedback, and you represent and warrant that you have all necessary rights to such content.
b. You agree to use Taïste solely for lawful purposes and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
a. Taïste provides a platform for culinary transactions, including ordering, delivery, and payment services.
d. All payments made through Taïste are final, and refunds or cancellations are subject to the respective provider\'s policies.
c. You agree to provide accurate and complete payment information and authorize Taïste to charge your selected payment method for all transactions.
b. Prices displayed on Taïste are determined by the respective providers and may be subject to additional taxes, fees, and delivery charges.
a. Taïste facilitates transactions between users and culinary service providers with Stripe Payments Services.
a. Taïste and its content, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, and software, are owned by or licensed to Taïste and are protected by intellectual property laws.
b. You may not copy, modify, distribute, or reverse engineer Taïste or any part of it without the Taïste\'s prior written consent.
a. Taïste collects and uses personal information in accordance with its Privacy Policy.
b. By using Taïste, you consent to Taïste\'s collection, use, and disclosure of personal information as described in the Privacy Policy.
a. Taïste is provided on an \'as-is\' basis without warranties of any kind, whether express or implied.
b. Taïste is not responsible for the quality, safety, or legality of the culinary services provided by third-party providers.
c. Taïste shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or relating to the use of Taïste or any transactions conducted through it.
a. Taïste reserves the right to suspend or terminate your access to Taïste at any time without notice if you violate this Agreement or engage in fraudulent or illegal activities.
a. Taïste may update or modify this Agreement from time to time, and any changes will be effective upon posting on Taïste.
b. Your continued use of Taïste after any modifications indicates your acceptance of the updated Agreement.
a. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the United States.
b. Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the United States.
This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and Taïste, Inc regarding your use of Taïste and supersedes any prior agreements or understandings.
Please read this Agreement carefully before using Taïste. If you do not agree with any provision of this Agreement, you should not access or use Taïste.

This Privacy Policy (\'Policy\') describes how Taïste, Inc (\'Provider\', \'we\', \'us\', or \'our\') collects, uses, and discloses personal information when you access or use our transaction-based culinary software-as-a-service mobile application (\'Taïste\'). By using Taïste, you agree to the terms and practices described in this Policy.
a. Personal Information: When you create an account or use Taïste, we may collect personal information such as your name, email address, phone number, and payment details.
b. Transaction Information: We collect information about your culinary transactions, including order details, delivery address, and payment history.
c. Usage and Device Information: We may collect information about your interactions with the App, such as your IP address, device information, operating system, and app usage data.
d. Location Information: With your consent, we may collect and process your precise location information to provide location-based services.
a. We use the collected information to provide, maintain, and improve Taïste\'s functionality and services, including order processing, delivery, and customer support.
b. We may use your email address or phone number to send transaction-related notifications, updates, and promotional communications, subject to your preferences and applicable laws.
c. We may aggregate and anonymize data for statistical and analytical purposes to enhance our services and better understand user preferences and trends.
a. We may share your personal information with culinary service providers to fulfill your orders and facilitate transactions.
b. We may share your information with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in operating Taïste, such as payment processors, delivery partners, and customer support providers.

c. We may disclose your information if required by law, regulation, or legal process, or if we believe in good faith that such disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, the safety of others, or investigate fraud or security issues.

d. In the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, your information may be transferred or disclosed as part of the transaction, subject to privacy laws and contractual obligations.
a. We retain personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law.
b. We may retain and use aggregated or anonymized data indefinitely for analytical purposes.
a. We implement reasonable security measures to protect personal information from unauthorized access, disclosure, or alteration.
b. However, no method of transmission or electronic storage is completely secure. Therefore, we cannot guarantee the absolute security of your information.

Taïste is not intended for individuals under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If we become aware that we have inadvertently collected personal information from a child, we will take steps to delete such information.
a. You may access, update, correct, or delete your personal information through Taïste\'s settings or by contacting us directly.
b. You may unsubscribe from marketing communications by following the instructions in the communication or adjusting your notification preferences.

c. Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have additional rights regarding your personal information, such as the right to object to processing or the right to data portability. Please contact us for further information.

Taïste may contain links to third-party websites or services that are not controlled or operated by us. This Policy does not apply to such third-party services, and we are not responsible for their privacy practices
*1 uppercase character, 1 special character, 1 number, 1 lowercase letter, 8 characters*
Brief bio expressing your interest in cooking
*All owners with more that 25% ownership must be reported.*
Brief Introduction, and why people should believe in your ability.
* Please answer all questions for you profile to appear to users*
How long have you been a personal chef?
What helps you excel in your pursuit of becoming a renowned chef?
Are you available for trial runs, weeks, and / or months?
Are you open to menu requests?
Additional Menu Items or Categories Requested
Please list exact menu item titles or categories.
When clicking on the MealKit Tab on the Home Screen, you will be prompted to the \'Menu Item Add\' Page. Enter your menu item details and save it into your profile.
*The following remain optional for catering items, but highly encouraged.*
2. Add your ingredients to the menu item.
You will be prompted, on the screen after adding your menu item, to add your ingredients to the menu item. Please type, or write, the list, take a picture of it, and upload it.
4. Create a Preparation Content Video around your Menu Item.

This Promotional Content Video will uniquely go over the preperation of your meal, and the quality you can bring to the service of catering. Additionally, it will promote your content to your audience and show the final product to be enjoyed.
You will have the option of accepting every order before scheduling it into your operations. This occurs in the \'Orders\' -> \'Pending\' Tab

You will be able to negotiate and request a travel fee with the consumer. This occurs in the \'Orders\' -> \'Pending\' -> \'Messages for Travel Fee\' tab. As soon as the user pays the travel fee, the order will be accepted and move to your \'Scheduled\' orders section.
We highly encourage constant communication with your consumer to ensure all remain on the same page in expectation. This can be done in the \'Scheduled\' -> \'Messages\' tab.

You are able to cancel any event at any time. In the event of a cancellation after the event has been scheduled, a convenience fee will be issued, taken out of your next payout, and issued to the consumer. 5% of the total order cost for all events more than 7 days from the time of cancellations; 15% for all events less than 7 days from the time of cancellation.
All Payouts will be issued exactly one hour of the events scheduling.
You have the option of listing up to 4 additional options. This will act as your culinary styling guide for consumers to best understand your expertise and focus.
This introduction will further detail your enthusiasm for cooking for your target audience.
These are frequently asked questions before consumers hire executive chefs.
1a. Add your ingredients to the executive items.
2a. Create a Preparation Guide for your customer.
3. Create a Preparation Guide for your customer.

Your preperation guide should consist of all the ingredients submitted with your menu item. Each ingredient should be paired with portion sizes and be detailed for the user to follow step by step. This guide will add detail in the preperation of the supposed item. Please type, or write, the list, take a picture of it, and upload it.
3a. Create a Promotional Content Video around your Menu Item.

This Promotional Content Video will uniquely go over the preperation of your meal, and the quality you can bring to your Executive Chef service. Additionally, it will promote your content to your audience and show the final product to be enjoyed.
*Only required for meal kit items, but encouraged*
